result.execSummary:
The defendant Geoffrey Olsen Wegleitner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Geoffrey Olsen Wegleitner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Geoffrey Olsen Wegleitner was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Geoffrey Olsen Wegleitner was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 read-in and dismissed.
Court dismisses Counts 4 through 7.
Defendant to report to Probation April 29, 2015 by 1:00 p.m.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation but must petition the Court.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF538.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF538.

-Cooperate with any correctional program, assessment and/or evaluation.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Defendant shall participate in the Restorative Justice Program if victim requests.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Jennifer Anne Bork   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Geoffrey Olsen Wegleitner appeared. Case called at 3:46 pm. Atty Andrea recites agreement. No objection from ADA Bork. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for counts two and three, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def Guilty of Count #2 and #3. Counts 4-7 are read in and dismissed.  Count #1 will be read in dismissed once Defendant reports to Probation. Parties make sentencing arguements. Defendant makes statement. Court questions. 
Crt orders: S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- Court costs; Payable through probation
- 30 Days Jail STAYED
- AODA within 30 days if requested
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any correctional program, assessment and /or evaluation
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Restortative Justice
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Defendant to sign up for probation by 4/29/2015 at 1:00 pm
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Eligible for probation unpoon successful completion of probation.
Plea hearing on April 28, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
